cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles south of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest, forecast to curve northwest tonight and then northward through the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch/Warning confined to the Florida Keys west of the Seven Mile Bridge to the Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys west of the Seven Mile Bridge to Dry Tortugas under Tropical Storm Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, southwest and west-central Florida coast, Florida Panhandle, northern Gulf Coast, and eventually portions of the Southeast U.S. inland
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds possible, but the probability of sustained tropical-storm force winds is only about 5%
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side near Port Everglades
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Saturday into Sunday with 3â€“5 inches possible and isolated totals to 8 inches, producing localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in south-central Florida beginning Saturday afternoon
